title: Trump Fires 17 Inspectors General, Obstructing Federal Oversight
summary: President Trump summarily fired 17 federal inspectors general without explanation, violating the 1978 Inspector General Act. The mass firing targeted officials investigating key areas, including Defense Department IG Robert Storch (SpaceX compliance review) and Agriculture Department IG Phyllis Fong (Neuralink investigation). The firings defied legal requirements for 30-day notice to Congress and specific justifications, representing an unprecedented assault on federal oversight mechanisms.
description: The mass firing of 17 independent watchdogs occurred via late-night emails from White House Presidential Personnel Office Director Sergio Gor. The firings specifically targeted inspectors general investigating Elon Musk's companies and other potential administration conflicts. Eight fired inspectors general later sued the Trump administration, arguing the terminations were unlawful and designed to obstruct federal oversight.
